a.title: Return to the homepage on the district site.

a.span: Affinia Healthcare at Normandy High School

h1.span: Remote Learning Update: Phase Two Rolls Out April 28

div.div: Posted by Curriculum & Instruction department on 4/24/2020

p.span: Hello Normandy Families,

As you know, our buildings have been closed since March 23 as part of the county, then states, stay-at-home order, but we are committed to continuing learning at home. And while we originally thought this was going to be a temporary situation, we now know remote learning will continue through the end of the school year, May 29. As this has become our new normal, we have been continuously looking at ways to make the effort more effective and engaging; therefore, we will be rolling out the next phase of remote learning on Tuesday, April 28.

We have partnered with Bellwether Education Partners to roll out this next phase in our remote learning program. Teachers will increase engagement with the use of tools like Google Meet and Zoom to have virtual classroom lessons for students to interact with each other and the teacher. These class sessions will be recorded then posted on Google Classroom for future reference.

Over the next phase of remote learning, students will be heavily focusing on literacy. Students will still have assignments in math, science, social studies, and some electives, but literacy is a top priority during the next five weeks.
Students will be provided ample opportunity to read, listen to, and respond to rich text. Every student will be provided with:

li.span: Grade-level texts, which teachers will be reading with students in a live virtual session

p.span: Literacy goals will also be set for students to fulfill by the end of the school year. (The last day of school is May 29.)

li.span: : Students need to read 2-4 books/articles by the end of the school year. This reading material will be chosen by the student and the teacher, considering a students independent reading abilities. Students will track their independent reading in a Reading Log in Google Classroom and submit it to their teacher at the end of each week. Often, books/articles can be accessed by students through Clever Portal. Grades 1 - 6 may use Learning A-Z (Raz Kids) in the Clever Portal, and grades 7 - 12 may use CommonLit and Newsela in the Clever Portal. Additional resources for books and texts are available; teachers may provide these to students individually. Please reach out to your teacher if Clever Portal assistance is needed, or if you would like to be provided with additional rich texts.
(reading during Zoom class session or Google Meet class session): Students need to read 4-8 books/articles by the end of the school year.

p.span: As part of this next phase, teachers will generate and distribute daily schedules for student assignments. These schedules will consist of live, online class sessions around literacy, which are virtual sessions with the classroom teacher in Zoom/Google Meet with the entire class or a select group of students.

For literacy digital learning, students in grades 1-12 will interact with teachers through Google Classroom, and PreKindergarten and Kindergarten students will use ClassDojo. Teachers will record whole-class Zoom/Google Meet sessions so students can view later if needed. Students will continue to use Edgenuity and other platforms for other subject areas.

On Monday, April 27, teachers will spend the day creating lesson plans for this next phase and will implement them in their classes on Tuesday, April 28. Star Assessments will take place on May 21-22. This phase of remote learning will possibly carry over into summer school and the 2020-2021 school year.

As you have heard many times, this is an unprecedented time in our society and yet, we still have an obligation to ensure our students have opportunity to continue with their education. If you have questions, please reach out to your childs teacher or building principal. We thank you for your participation and cooperation in your childs education!

p.strong: Q: How will students access the assigned books? Are they available online?

p.span: A: Books/articles can be accessed by students through Clever Portal. Grades 1 - 6 will use Learning A-Z (Raz Kids) in the Clever Portal, and grades 7 - 12 will use CommonLit and Newsela in the Clever Portal. Please reach out to your teacher if Clever Portal assistance is needed, or if you would like to be provided with additional rich texts.

p.strong: Q: Is there a special login/website needed to access assignments for Phase Two?

p.span: A: No, teachers who have used Google Classroom will continue to utilize this platform. If your childs teacher is just starting to use Google Classroom or Zoom, they will send your child a link to login. In addition, students will continue to access learning resources through the Clever Portal --

p.strong: Q: What if my child is not available for the teachers scheduled Zoom/Google Meet class?

p.span: A: Online class sessions will be recorded and shared with students in Google Classroom so that students can access them at a later time.

p.strong: Q: Per week, how often will my child be expected to meet via Zoom/Google Meet with their teacher and/or class?

p.span: A: This will depend on the needs of individual students. You may expect approximately 2-5 live sessions per week.

p.strong: Q: How will my child take the Star Assessment?

p.span: A: Details on how your child will take the Star Assessment will be shared at a later date.

p.strong: Q: What if my child does not have a Chromebook or laptop?

p.span: A: We have a limited number of Chromebooks available. If your child needs one, please contact your childs building principal. We also have printed assignments that school principals can provide by request.

a.aria-label: Go to comments for Remote Learning Update: Phase Two Rolls Out April 28

h1.span: Changes to Grab & Go Meal Delivery Plan

div.div: Posted by Normandy Schools Collaborative on 4/23/2020

div.p: Changes to Grab & Go Meal Delivery:Beginning Thursday, April 23, the Grab & Go meals will be distributed at schools only on Mondays and Thursdays. To minimize possible exposure to COVID 19, meals will no longer be dropped off at bus stops throughout the district.Meals will be availableat drive-through pickup locations at each school(except CASA) between the hours of 11 a.m. & 12:30 p.m., on Mondays and Thursdays.

p.span: Students can get meals for the days without pick-up service. For example, on Monday, families can get meals for Monday, Tuesday & Wednesday (on Thursday, pick-up for Thursday & Friday, etc).

a.aria-label: Go to comments for Changes to Grab & Go Meal Delivery Plan

h1.span: Normandy, Area School Buildings to Remain Closed for Balance of 2019-2020 School Year

div.div: Posted by Normandy Schools Collaborative on 4/9/2020

strong.span: Districts to Continue Remote Learning for Students

p.span: Due to the current COVID-19 pandemic and for the ongoing safety of students, staff and the community at-large, area school superintendents have conferred, collaborated and come to the difficult decision to keep schools closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year.

This decision follows recommendations from local health departments and is in collaboration with government officials. District superintendents will continue to follow the guidance of these experts as decisions are made on end-of-year events in the best interest of the health and safety of district students, staff, and communities.

These are unprecedented times for communities, and for education. The safety of all students and staff remains uppermost in our minds. With the decision to physically close all schools until the end of the year, we are working to assure that safety, said Dr. Charles J. Pearson, Normandy Superintendent of Schools. I want to thank our students, teachers, staff, and families for their patience and cooperation during this challenging period in our lives. We will get through this and working together will be the key.

Normandy has been providing free Grab & Go meals to any student within the footprint, and plans to continue this offering until the end of May (the original end of the school year). The district is also finalizing plans for its next distribution of Chromebooks for students to continue learning remotely. Updated information on the meal and Chromebook distribution will be shared once plans are finalized.

This is our commitment remote learning will continue for all students, whether we are working with technology or with printed packets, Dr. Pearson continued. We will continue to provide meals to families and students in need as safely as possible. NSC will continue to collaborate with all community partners to meet the needs of students and families in the 24:1."

No decisions have been made regarding specific end-of-year activities such as prom or graduation. District staff are working with health and government officials to determine if these events will occur or held at a later date. The Missouri Department of Elementary and Secondary Education is working to determine how districts will handle summer school. Families will be notified once decisions have been made regarding these matters.
For information on district and community resources, and remote learning plans available during the COVID-19 crisis, please visit
